hint.text:
Terms common to both the numerator and denominator can be cancelled.
For example :
\(\frac{x^3abc}{xab},\,\)where x, a, b, c are non-zero intergers; can be expressed as
\('x^2c'\,\)because \('xab'\,\)is the common term for the numerator and denominator.

solution.text:
\(\frac{_{{j*k*l}}_x^2ac}{_{l}_x^4a}\)
Taking \(_{l}_x^2a\,\)common in the numerator and the denominator,
\(=\frac{_{{j*k}}_c(_{l}_x^2a)}{x^2(_{l}_x^2a)}\)
Dividing numerator and denominator by \(_{l}_x^2a,\)
\(=\frac{_{{j*k}}_c}{x^2}\)
